pullRequest.body:
add the Mean Value Theorem for Banach spaces to the library and include reference for the theorem statement

This theorem states that if `f : X â†’ Y` is differentiable along the line segment from `a` to `b`, then the change in `f` equals the integral of its derivative along this path. This extends the mean value theorem to Banach spaces. This can be used for the eventual proof of the Newton-Kantorovich theorem with 1 constant contained inside the added reference.

Here is the discussion on Zulipchat: https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/287929-mathlib4/topic/Contributing.20FTC-2.20for.20Banach.20spaces

### PR summary [b5a00d9fb4](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/15212/commits/b5a00d9fb4e4fcf77a0626544f1b6c0b237f4255)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|

</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ integral_eq_sub_of_hasFDerivAt`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

Hello @victorliu5296, thank you for your interest in contributing.  Did this PR arise from a discussion on Zulip (if so, could you please edit your original message to include a link to that discussion?). Or did you have the idea for this PR yourself?  If the latter, could you please explain how the existing versions of FTC-2 don't quite work for your use case?

My impression is that the proof here can be simplified somewhat, but let's determine the statement(s) needed, if any, before working on optimizing the proof.

> Hello @victorliu5296, thank you for your interest in contributing. Did this PR arise from a discussion on Zulip (if so, could you please edit your original message to include a link to that discussion?). Or did you have the idea for this PR yourself? If the latter, could you please explain how the existing versions of FTC-2 don't quite work for your use case?
> 
> My impression is that the proof here can be simplified somewhat, but let's determine the statement(s) needed, if any, before working on optimizing the proof.

Hi, I have brought this proof in order to complete a proof on a version of the [Newton-Kantorovich theorem](https://github.com/victorliu5296/newton-kantorovich-theorem) that involves the theorem in the context of Banach spaces.

The proof involves the theorem for an interval $[a,b]$ in a Banach space $X$ defined by the parameterization $a + t \cdot (b - a) = (1 - t) \cdot a + t \cdot b$ for $t \in [0,1]$. Unfortunately, existing versions such as [integral_unitInterval_deriv_eq_sub](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Integral/FundThmCalculus.html#intervalIntegral.integral_unitInterval_deriv_eq_sub) only cover the case where $a$ and $b$ are in a field, not a more general Banach space.

pullRequest.title: feat: Add fundamental theorem of calculus-2 for Banach spaces

Hello @victorliu5296, thank you for your interest in contributing.  Did this PR arise from a discussion on Zulip (if so, could you please edit your original message to include a link to that discussion?). Or did you have the idea for this PR yourself?  If the latter, could you please explain how the existing versions of FTC-2 don't quite work for your use case?

My impression is that the proof here can be simplified somewhat, but let's determine the statement(s) needed, if any, before working on optimizing the proof.

> Hello @victorliu5296, thank you for your interest in contributing. Did this PR arise from a discussion on Zulip (if so, could you please edit your original message to include a link to that discussion?). Or did you have the idea for this PR yourself? If the latter, could you please explain how the existing versions of FTC-2 don't quite work for your use case?
> 
> My impression is that the proof here can be simplified somewhat, but let's determine the statement(s) needed, if any, before working on optimizing the proof.

Hi, I have brought this proof in order to complete a proof on a version of the [Newton-Kantorovich theorem](https://github.com/victorliu5296/newton-kantorovich-theorem) that involves the theorem in the context of Banach spaces.

The proof involves the theorem for an interval $[a,b]$ in a Banach space $X$ defined by the parameterization $a + t \cdot (b - a) = (1 - t) \cdot a + t \cdot b$ for $t \in [0,1]$. Unfortunately, existing versions such as [integral_unitInterval_deriv_eq_sub](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Integral/FundThmCalculus.html#intervalIntegral.integral_unitInterval_deriv_eq_sub) only cover the case where $a$ and $b$ are in a field, not a more general Banach space.
